medical_history.chief_complaint: Management of adenocarcinoma of the rectum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted blood in his stools approximately 3 months prior to evaluation, without associated pain. Over the next 6 weeks, he noted a decreasing caliber of stools, and 1 month before presentation, blood and mucus were present with stools.
medical_history.family_history: The patientâ€™s father had colonic polyps; his maternal grandmother had colon cancer diagnosed at age 75.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not smoke, worked in an office, and lived with a male partner.
